response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for UUID Generation using pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document outlines effective testing strategies for verifying the correctness and robustness of UUID generation using the popular testing framework, pytest, within Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand and leverage built-in UUID functions in Python 3.12+ for generating and validating UUIDs
Create test cases to ensure proper handling of different UUID versions (v1, v4, v5, and v6)
Test the generation of random UUIDs with various seed values
Explore the impact of system time on the generation of time-based UUIDs (v1 and v3)
Verify that the generated UUIDs are properly formatted according to RFC 4122
Check for unique UUID generation by creating multiple tests with assertions against each other
version_notes: Python 3.12+: Introduced new UUID functions, e.g., uuid5() and uuid6(), for generating v5 and v6 UUIDs respectively.
Previous versions of Python relied on third-party libraries to generate certain UUID types.
caveats: Ensure that tests are run with a seeded random number generator to maintain consistent output during testing.
Remember to handle exceptions when working with time-based UUIDs to account for system clock differences between test runs.
